text:
Zoo's plan to dissect dead lion in front of children hit by protest as thousands share Facebook petition 13:42, 13 Oct 2015 Warning, graphic content: Odense Zoo is planning to publicly dissect a lion in front of a crowd of children, and the internet is trying to stop it Share Get daily news by email Invalid e-mail Thanks for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later The dissection of a lion 
Odense Zoo in Denmark created a firestorm of online controversy last year when it dissected a giraffe in front of the public . 
Marius the giraffe who was killed by Copenhagen Zoo despite offers to re-home 
It plans to do the same on Thursday with the dead body of a lion and social networks have erupted in protest. 
The online petition to stop the dissection has been shared over a thousand times and has received over 1,300 "likes". 
The petition being shared on Facebook 
"This place needs to be shut down PERMANENTLY!!," wrote Facebook user Terre Nova - a comment that garnered over 300 likes. 
Rachel Borene, another Facebook user, wrote: "It's one thing to breed animals for food, but why breed big cats if you don't have enough room in your zoo? Culling a young zoo animal is barbaric. This zoo seems to be so emotionally detached from these animals." 
Zookeeper Michael Wallberg Soerensen said the Odense Zoo, about 105 miles west of Copenhagen, has performed public dissections for 20 years and that they are "not for entertainment" but are educational. 
Det har skabt en del debat, at Odense ZOO vil dissekere en løve i efterårsferien. Debatten er velkommen, da den er med... 
"We are not chopping up animals for fun. We believe in sharing knowledge," Wallberg Soerensen said. 
"It is important not to give animals human attributes that they do not have." 
The female lion was put down nine months ago because the zoo had too many felines and was dissected publicly in order to give people "a closer-to-the-animals experience". Poll loading …
